intro: Lesquerella valida, commonly known as the narrowleaf lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has compound leaves with linear lobes. Its seeds are rich in erucic acid, making it valuable for industrial and medicinal uses. Lesquerella valida thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
